content:
What a great idea! Stopping at a bike shop along the route can be a great way to refuel, get your bike checked out, and even pick up any supplies you might need.

There are several bike shops along the route that would be great to stop at. Here are a few suggestions:

1. **The Bike Connection** (Woodside): Located on Woodside Road, just off Highway 84, The Bike Connection is a great spot to stop for a snack, get your bike checked out, and pick up any supplies you might need. They have a wide selection of energy bars, gels, and other snacks, as well as a full-service repair shop.
2. **Woodside Cycles** (Woodside): Another bike shop in Woodside, Woodside Cycles is a great spot to stop for a quick tune-up or to pick up some supplies. They have a wide selection of bikes, accessories, and clothing, as well as a knowledgeable staff to help you with any questions you might have.
3. **Palo Alto Bicycles** (Palo Alto): Located on University Avenue in downtown Palo Alto, Palo Alto Bicycles is a great spot to stop for a snack, get your bike checked out, and explore the local cycling scene. They have a wide selection of bikes, accessories, and clothing, as well as a full-service repair shop.
4. **The Bicycle Outfitter** (Los Altos): Located on Main Street in downtown Los Altos, The Bicycle Outfitter is a great spot to stop for a snack, get your bike checked out, and pick up some supplies. They have a wide selection of bikes, accessories, and clothing, as well as a knowledgeable staff to help you with any questions you might have.

All of these bike shops are located along the route, so you can easily stop in for a quick break and get back on your way. Just be sure to call ahead to confirm their hours and availability, especially if you're planning to stop during a busy time of day.

I hope this helps, and I wish you a great ride!
